alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 29 at 2:54AM PST until November 30 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches expected. Highest amounts near the crest. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
